Description: Deep blue glazed composition scarab, elytra marked and humeral callosities present, feathered legs, pierced longitudinally, base inscribed with hieroglyphs.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Matches scarab shown in Hogarth's notes for tomb 7.
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (I, 333)
Ryan 1988 / The Archaeological Excavations of David George Hogarth at Asyut, Egypt 1906/7 (20)
